summary: This bill, the U.S.-European Nuclear Energy Cooperation Act of 2025, mandates the Secretary of State, in consultation with other agencies, to develop a strategy for strengthening U.S.-European nuclear energy cooperation and counteracting Russian influence in the European nuclear energy sector. The strategy must include assessments of reactor types, fuel cycles, U.S. government technologies, diplomatic engagements, and Russian/Chinese influence. It also authorizes $30 million annually from 2025-2029 for activities related to countering Russian influence and supporting nuclear power programs.
